interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: HOCUS POCUS
Review Date: 2020/08/25
Store: Bette Midler  (Actor),     Sarah Jessica Parker  (Actor),     Kenny Ortega  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['In Disney\'s HOCUS POCUS, Academy Award(R) nominee Bette Midler (Best Actress, 1991, FOR THE BOYS), stars with Sarah Jessica Parker (SEX AND THE CITY) and Kathy Najimy (THE WEDDING PLANNER) as three wild witches who return from seventeenth-century Salem for a night of zany fun and comic chaos. After they\'re conjured up by unsuspecting pranksters, the tricky trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth. But first they must outwit three feisty kids determined to foil their scheme! Filled with bewitching laughs and magic, this hilarious film is perfect for the whole family!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.']
Average Rating: 4.8

['In Disney\'s HOCUS POCUS, Academy Award(R) nominee Bette Midler (Best Actress, 1991, FOR THE BOYS), stars with Sarah Jessica Parker (SEX AND THE CITY) and Kathy Najimy (THE WEDDING PLANNER) as three wild witches who return from seventeenth-century Salem for a night of zany fun and comic chaos. After they\'re conjured up by unsuspecting pranksters, the tricky trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth. But first they must outwit three feisty kids determined to foil their scheme! Filled with bewitching laughs and magic, this hilarious film is perfect for the whole family!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Interest in Family-Friendly Films**: The user enjoys movies that are suitable for family viewing, indicated by a preference for a PG-rated film that offers humor and magic.
  
- **Appreciation for Classic and Nostalgic Content**: The choice of a film centered around witches and the specific title suggests a fondness for nostalgic films, particularly those tied to childhood memories or popular culture.

- **Positive Engagement with Popular Acts**: They have a strong appreciation for works featuring well-known actors, indicating a preference for acknowledged talents like Bette Midler and Sarah Jessica Parker.

- **Value for Quality and Affordability**: The user's feedback highlights a desire for good value when purchasing media, as evidenced by their satisfaction with the price point of the DVD.

- **Support for Entertaining Storytelling**: The interest in a comedic narrative filled with whimsical elements reflects a preference for light-hearted storylines filled with imaginative concepts.

Overall, the user demonstrates a clear inclination towards enchanting, family-oriented stories that mix humor with nostalgic elements, particularly those rooted in popular cinematic culture.
